intro: Spigelia guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually red or orange-red, with a distinctive tubular shape and prominent stamens. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
